title: The Hawaiian story of the wind keepers - Sydney Iaukea

multiple-choice.question: Who was the Hawaiian wind goddess that wielded a gourd housing the winds of the Islands?

options.label: A
options.text: La'amaomao

options.label: B
options.text: Paka'a

options.label: C
options.text: Kuapaka'a

options.label: D
options.text: King Keawenuia'umi

multiple-choice.question: What was passed to Paka'a from his grandmother, La'amaomao?

options.label: A
options.text: The sacred wind gourd

options.label: B
options.text: The life force of the Islands

options.label: C
options.text: The names of the winds

options.label: D
options.text: The position of attendant to the king

multiple-choice.question: Why did the two navigators turn the king against Paka'a?

options.label: A
options.text: Because Paka'a was not doing his job properly

options.label: B
options.text: Because they were envious of Paka'a's position and skills

options.label: C
options.text: Because Paka'a was plotting against the king

options.label: D
options.text: Because the king asked them to

multiple-choice.question: Where did Paka'a take refuge after being stripped of his land and privileges?

options.label: A
options.text: Hawaii Island

options.label: B
options.text: Molokaʻi

options.label: C
options.text: Ka'ula

options.label: D
options.text: A distant island

multiple-choice.question: What did Paka'a teach his son, Kuapaka'a?

options.label: A
options.text: How to sail a canoe

options.label: B
options.text: How to navigate the seas

options.label: C
options.text: The way of the winds

options.label: D
options.text: How to be a good attendant to the king

multiple-choice.question: Why did Paka'a's ancestral spirits rot the trees the king was using for canoe-building?

options.label: A
options.text: To test the king's loyalty and dedication

options.label: B
options.text: To punish the king for turning against Paka'a

options.label: C
options.text: To help the king find Paka'a

options.label: D
options.text: To hinder the king's journey

multiple-choice.question: What did Kuapaka'a do to the king's fleet when they passed Molokaʻi?

options.label: A
options.text: He joined them on their journey

options.label: B
options.text: He warned them of a storm and then unleashed it

options.label: C
options.text: He ignored them and let them pass

options.label: D
options.text: He attacked them with his winds

multiple-choice.question: What did Kuapaka'a wager against the eight fishermen in the canoe race?

options.label: A
options.text: His catch of flying fish

options.label: B
options.text: His canoe

options.label: C
options.text: His position as attendant to the king

options.label: D
options.text: His life

multiple-choice.question: Why did Kuapaka'a reveal his identity to the king?

options.label: A
options.text: To have mercy on the eight fishermen

options.label: B
options.text: To have the king prove his commitment to Paka'a

options.label: C
options.text: To show off his skills

options.label: D
options.text: To take revenge on the king

multiple-choice.question: What did Paka'a and Kuapaka'a ensure would never be lost or forgotten?

options.label: A
options.text: The names of the winds

options.label: B
options.text: The way of the navigators

options.label: C
options.text: The position of attendant to the king

options.label: D
options.text: The life force of the Islands
